metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4943 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
The PPPoL2TP feature in net/l2tp/l2tp_ppp.c in the Linux kernel through 3.15.6 allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging data-structure differences between an l2tp socket and an inet socket. Sasha Levin reported a flaw in the Linux kernel's point-to-point protocol (PPP) when used with the Layer Two Tunneling Protocol (L2TP). A local user could exploit this flaw to gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-32-generic - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-lowlatency - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-32-generic - 3.13.0-32.57
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-lowlatency - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc64-emb - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc64-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-extra-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-lowlatency - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1

linux-image-extra-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.13.0-32-generic - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-lowlatency - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-32.57

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 13.10 preview kernels android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.04 preview kernels

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-32.57').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-32.57').
